title: Meditation
description: Widget to move game time forward
longDescription:
Widget written in C++ to maximize efficiency during complex math operations. Widget handles visuals and code to calculate the correct value of how many hours to move forward. 360 degrees on clock represent 24 hours cycle. As you can see on photos there is space on the top to allow widget to be part of player menu system.


Quick Overview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t-BP2FgadTw

Documentation Part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hVhY8_Ilpbg

Documentation Part 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlJ5sGk3Y9s

Documentation Part 3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mavXP_lQ2jY

Documentation Part 4: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=69yDINxKwtA

Documentation Part 5: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zm8xrhmaDc

Discord link: https://discord.gg/vb6DYqUpzT
technicalDetails:
Features:

  •  widget written in C++ to calculate how many hours to move time forward based on the position of user mouse click and current game time
  •  static meshes included if you want to fully customize the textures
  •  you can customize layout and colors
  • well commented C++ code
  • full instructional setup video with Game Time Manager plugin example


Code Modules: Meditation (Runtime)

Number of Blueprints: 3

Number of C++ Classes: 9

Number of Materials: 2

Number of Static Meshes: 5

Number of Textures: 8

Network Replicated: (No)

Supported Development Platforms: Win64

Supported Target Build Platforms: Win64


Important/Additional Notes: This plugin doesn't provide actual game time management. This plugin handles user interaction visuals and math calculation based on position of mouse cursor. To achieve full functionality of plugin you will need to follow the documentation videos and merge it either with your own game time system or use GameTimeManager plugin available at Unreal Market Place as showcased in the documentation videos.
